Senator Clinton the overall winner, but Senator Obama gets a bunch of delegates.
What do the exit polls tell you about the Latino vote and the women's vote and how they break for Senator Clinton and Senator Obama?
We haven't gotten any exit polling results out of California.
I think nobody really wanted to do it for California as much.
But the pre-election polls indicated that the Latino vote was going to go very heavily for Hillary Clinton, and there's no reason to believe that that hasn't happened.
In fact, that was her most impressive subgroup in pre-election polling.
The Latino voters supported her by the largest margin of any subgroup.

Today Arpaio is best known for his aggressive pursuit of people suspected of being in the U.S.
illegally.
But back then in 1995, he was focused on fathers and mothers who were behind in their child support payments.
Weekend ALL THINGS CONSIDERED host Daniel Zwerdling interviewed Arpaio that summer.
The sheriff had just rounded up more than 100 so-called deadbeat parents.
(SOUNDBITE OF ARCHIVED BROADCAST)
I sent out a 160-volunteer posse, men and women.
This armed posse would arrest the parents and bring them to Arpaio's command center.
(SOUNDBITE OF ARCHIVED BROADCAST)
We did take some people away their jobs.
And then we booked them all, and they stayed in jail until either they paid their bail.
By the way, the bail is set at the amount that's owed.
If you owe a thousand dollars child support, you have to put up a thousand dollars.
Zwerdling asked Arpaio why he would expend so much effort to round up negligent parents, and Arpaio answered this way.
(SOUNDBITE OF ARCHIVED BROADCAST)
Our young people are the future of this country.
And when children or even teenagers do not have the money to pay for clothes and food and education, I think it's very serious.
We have to take care of our young people.
Sheriff Joe Arpaio talking to NPR on August 6, 1995, his first appearance on these airwaves.

What do we know about the federal investigation of Congressman Curt Weldon?
Well, this is - I mean politically it's a big Republican seat.
Curt Weldon has never had a tough race.
But the FBI announced, or there was some kind of announcement, that their - they raided his daughter's offices, Curt Weldon's daughter.
